page.title: 13LANDSCAPE.HOLT. WORCS.
page.content: Undulating, max. 250ft above sea level with steep access to the river water meadows which are mainly grassland. Cultivated fields for arable farming, orcharding, woodlands and narrow lanes complete the scene but a Quarry has considerably altered some natural contours. {CHURCH:}Norman with l2th and l3th century additions featuring and early Norman tower,circa 1070. {A {HAGIOSCOPE}is in the west wall of the Chapel and Scratch Dial or Mass Clock in the South Wall. Outside by the Lych Gate there is a Mounting Stone.{CASTLE}situated by the Church the central keep dates from 1072 A.D. The Castle is now a private home with a section converted into flats. {BRIDGE }designed by Thomas Telford in 1828. Examples of 19th and 20th century housing can be seen at Holt Heath.
